paragraphs.text:
%md
# HyperLogLog

Hyperloglog addresses the problem in determining cardinality on large datasets. Usefull for efficiantly summerizing streams of data such as number of unique visitors of a website or counting ad impressions.

paragraphs.title: Add Spark Dependencies
paragraphs.text:
%dep

//Add these dependencies to the interpreter to make your life easier...

z.reset()
z.load("com.twitter:algebird-core_2.11:0.13.3")
z.load("org.apache.bahir:spark-streaming-twitter_2.10:2.1.0")

paragraphs.title: Create Keyspace
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS approximations WITH REPLICATION = { 'class' : 'SimpleStrategy', 'replication_factor' : 1 };

paragraphs.title: Create Table
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS approximations.hlldata ( id text, date text, batchtime timestamp, batchwindow int, totalinwindow int, uniqueperbatch int, hllstore blob, PRIMARY KEY ((id, date), batchTime));

paragraphs.title: Create Search Index for Timeseries
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE SEARCH  INDEX IF NOT EXISTS ON approximations.hlldata WITH COLUMNS batchtime;

%spark
import com.datastax.spark.connector.streaming._
import com.datastax.spark.connector._
import com.datastax.spark.connector.SomeColumns
import com.datastax.spark.connector.rdd._
import org.apache.spark.SparkContext    
import org.apache.spark.SparkContext._
import org.apache.spark.SparkConf
import org.apache.spark.storage.StorageLevel
import org.apache.spark.streaming.{Seconds, StreamingContext}

import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLog._
import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLogMonoid
import org.apache.log4j.{Level, Logger}
import com.twitter.algebird.HLL
import java.util.Date
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat

val todayAsString = new SimpleDateFormat("MM-dd-yyyy").format(new Date())
   
val rdd  = sc.cassandraTable[Array[Byte]]("approximations", "hlldata")
              .select("hllstore")
              .where("id = ?", "tweets").where("date = ?", todayAsString)

val approxUsers = rdd.mapPartitions(ids => {
  ids.map(id => fromBytes(id))
}).reduce(_ + _)

val hllagg = approxUsers.estimatedSize.toInt

println("Total For HLL:"+hllagg)

%cassandra

SELECT * FROM approximations.hlldata WHERE id = 'tweets' ALLOW FILTERING;
